title: Passport Index Database
description: Tracking historical changes in passport rankings and visa requirements.

strongest_passports.sql:
SELECT c.name as country, cr.year, cr.rank, cr.visa_free_count
FROM Country c
JOIN CountryRanking cr ON c.code = cr.country_code
WHERE cr.year = CASE WHEN :year IS NULL OR :year = '' THEN (SELECT MAX(year) FROM CountryRanking) ELSE :year END
ORDER BY cr.rank ASC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 20 ELSE :limit END
strongest_passports.title: Countries with Strongest Passports
strongest_passports.description: Shows countries with the most powerful passports based on ranking and visa-free access. Default shows top 20 countries for the most recent year. Use year=YYYY for historical data, and limit=N to change the number of results.

weakest_passports.sql:
SELECT c.name as country, cr.year, cr.rank, cr.visa_free_count
FROM Country c
JOIN CountryRanking cr ON c.code = cr.country_code
WHERE cr.year = CASE WHEN :year IS NULL OR :year = '' THEN (SELECT MAX(year) FROM CountryRanking) ELSE :year END
ORDER BY cr.rank DESC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 20 ELSE :limit END
weakest_passports.title: Countries with Weakest Passports
weakest_passports.description: Shows countries with the most restricted passports based on ranking and visa-free access. Default shows 20 countries for most recent year. Use year=YYYY for historical data, and limit=N to change the number of results.

visa_reciprocity.sql:
WITH reciprocity AS (
  SELECT 
    c1.name as from_country,
    c2.name as to_country,
    vr1.requirement_type as outbound_requirement,
    vr2.requirement_type as inbound_requirement,
    CASE WHEN vr1.requirement_type = vr2.requirement_type THEN 'Reciprocal' ELSE 'Non-reciprocal' END as relationship,
    vr1.effective_date
  FROM VisaRequirement vr1
  JOIN VisaRequirement vr2 ON vr1.from_country = vr2.to_country AND vr1.to_country = vr2.from_country
  JOIN Country c1 ON vr1.from_country = c1.code
  JOIN Country c2 ON vr1.to_country = c2.code
  WHERE vr1.effective_date = (SELECT MAX(effective_date) FROM VisaRequirement WHERE from_country = vr1.from_country AND to_country = vr1.to_country)
  AND vr2.effective_date = (SELECT MAX(effective_date) FROM VisaRequirement WHERE from_country = vr2.from_country AND to_country = vr2.to_country)
  AND (COALESCE(NULLIF(:from_country, ''), 'SG') = vr1.from_country)
  AND (:to_country IS NULL OR :to_country = '' OR vr1.to_country = :to_country)
)
SELECT from_country, to_country, outbound_requirement, inbound_requirement, relationship, effective_date
FROM reciprocity
ORDER BY from_country, to_country
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 100 ELSE :limit END
visa_reciprocity.title: Visa Reciprocity Analysis
visa_reciprocity.description: Compares visa requirements between pairs of countries to identify reciprocal and non-reciprocal relationships. Use country codes (e.g., 'SG', 'US') for from_country and to_country parameters. Default from_country is 'SG' for Singapore.

regional_visa_analysis.sql:
SELECT
  c1.region as from_region,
  c2.region as to_region,
  vr.requirement_type,
  COUNT(*) as count
FROM VisaRequirement vr
JOIN Country c1 ON vr.from_country = c1.code
JOIN Country c2 ON vr.to_country = c2.code
WHERE vr.effective_date = (
  SELECT MAX(effective_date) FROM VisaRequirement 
  WHERE from_country = vr.from_country AND to_country = vr.to_country
  AND (strftime('%Y', effective_date) = CASE WHEN :year IS NULL OR :year = '' THEN (SELECT MAX(strftime('%Y', effective_date)) FROM VisaRequirement) ELSE :year END)
)
AND (:from_region IS NULL OR :from_region = '' OR c1.region = :from_region)
AND (:to_region IS NULL OR :to_region = '' OR c2.region = :to_region)
GROUP BY c1.region, c2.region, vr.requirement_type
ORDER BY c1.region, c2.region, count DESC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 100 ELSE :limit END
regional_visa_analysis.title: Regional Visa Requirement Patterns
regional_visa_analysis.description: Aggregates visa requirements between world regions to identify regional patterns. Use region names (e.g., 'EUROPE', 'ASIA') for from_region and to_region parameters. Set year=YYYY for historical data.

passport_strength_change.sql:
WITH yearly_ranks AS (
  SELECT 
    c.name as country,
    c.code as country_code,
    cr.year,
    cr.rank,
    cr.visa_free_count,
    LAG(cr.rank) OVER (PARTITION BY cr.country_code ORDER BY cr.year) as prev_rank,
    LAG(cr.visa_free_count) OVER (PARTITION BY cr.country_code ORDER BY cr.year) as prev_visa_free_count
  FROM CountryRanking cr
  JOIN Country c ON cr.country_code = c.code
  WHERE (:country_code IS NULL OR :country_code = '' OR c.code = :country_code)
)
SELECT 
  country,
  country_code,
  year,
  rank,
  visa_free_count,
  prev_rank,
  prev_visa_free_count,
  (prev_rank - rank) as rank_improvement,
  (visa_free_count - prev_visa_free_count) as visa_free_increase
FROM yearly_ranks
WHERE prev_rank IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY year DESC, rank_improvement DESC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 100 ELSE :limit END
passport_strength_change.title: Passport Strength Changes Over Time
passport_strength_change.description: Tracks how countries' passport rankings and visa-free access have changed between consecutive years. Positive rank_improvement values indicate better ranking. Filter by country_code (e.g., 'SG', 'US').

visa_policy_changes.sql:
SELECT 
  vr2.effective_date as change_date,
  c1.name as from_country,
  c1.code as from_country_code,
  c2.name as to_country,
  c2.code as to_country_code,
  vr1.requirement_type as old_requirement,
  vr2.requirement_type as new_requirement,
  CASE 
    WHEN vr1.requirement_type = 'visa_required' AND vr2.requirement_type IN ('visa_free', 'visa_on_arrival', 'visa_free_access', 'electronic_travel_authorisation') THEN 'Liberalization'
    WHEN vr1.requirement_type IN ('visa_free', 'visa_on_arrival', 'visa_free_access', 'electronic_travel_authorisation') AND vr2.requirement_type = 'visa_required' THEN 'Restriction'
    ELSE 'Policy Change'
  END as change_type
FROM VisaRequirement vr1
JOIN VisaRequirement vr2 ON 
  vr1.from_country = vr2.from_country AND 
  vr1.to_country = vr2.to_country AND
  vr2.effective_date > vr1.effective_date
JOIN Country c1 ON vr1.from_country = c1.code
JOIN Country c2 ON vr1.to_country = c2.code
WHERE NOT EXISTS (
  SELECT 1 FROM VisaRequirement vr3
  WHERE vr3.from_country = vr1.from_country
  AND vr3.to_country = vr1.to_country
  AND vr3.effective_date > vr1.effective_date
  AND vr3.effective_date < vr2.effective_date
)
AND (:from_country IS NULL OR :from_country = '' OR vr1.from_country = :from_country)
AND (:to_country IS NULL OR :to_country = '' OR vr1.to_country = :to_country)
AND ((:year_from IS NULL OR :year_from = '') OR CAST(strftime('%Y', vr2.effective_date) AS INTEGER) >= CAST(:year_from AS INTEGER))
AND ((:year_to IS NULL OR :year_to = '') OR CAST(strftime('%Y', vr2.effective_date) AS INTEGER) <= CAST(:year_to AS INTEGER))
ORDER BY vr2.effective_date DESC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 100 ELSE :limit END
visa_policy_changes.title: Visa Policy Changes Over Time
visa_policy_changes.description: Tracks significant historical changes in visa policies between countries. Use country codes (e.g., 'SG', 'US') for from_country and to_country. Filter date range with year_from=YYYY and year_to=YYYY (e.g., year_from=2015, year_to=2020).

regional_passport_strength.sql:
SELECT 
  c.region,
  cr.year,
  ROUND(AVG(cr.rank), 2) as avg_rank,
  ROUND(AVG(cr.visa_free_count), 2) as avg_visa_free_count,
  MIN(cr.rank) as best_rank,
  MAX(cr.visa_free_count) as max_visa_free_count,
  COUNT(DISTINCT c.code) as countries_in_region
FROM Country c
JOIN CountryRanking cr ON c.code = cr.country_code
  AND cr.year = CASE WHEN :year IS NULL OR :year = '' THEN (SELECT MAX(year) FROM CountryRanking) ELSE :year END
GROUP BY c.region, cr.year
ORDER BY cr.year DESC, avg_rank ASC
regional_passport_strength.title: Regional Passport Strength Comparison
regional_passport_strength.description: Compares average passport strength by world region. Filter by year=YYYY for historical data. Lower avg_rank values indicate stronger passports.

visa_requirement_distribution.sql:
WITH selected_year AS (
  SELECT CASE WHEN :year IS NULL OR :year = '' THEN (SELECT MAX(strftime('%Y', effective_date)) FROM VisaRequirement) ELSE :year END AS year
),
latest_requirements AS (
  SELECT vr.*, strftime('%Y', vr.effective_date) as year
  FROM VisaRequirement vr
  JOIN selected_year sy ON strftime('%Y', vr.effective_date) = sy.year
  WHERE vr.effective_date = (
    SELECT MAX(effective_date) FROM VisaRequirement
    WHERE from_country = vr.from_country AND to_country = vr.to_country
      AND strftime('%Y', effective_date) = sy.year
  )
)
SELECT
  year,
  requirement_type,
  COUNT(*) as count,
  ROUND(COUNT(*) * 100.0 / (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM latest_requirements), 2) as percentage
FROM latest_requirements
GROUP BY year, requirement_type
ORDER BY count DESC
LIMIT CASE WHEN :limit IS NULL OR :limit = '' THEN 20 ELSE :limit END
visa_requirement_distribution.title: Global Visa Requirement Distribution
visa_requirement_distribution.description: Shows the distribution of different visa requirement types worldwide with counts and percentages. Use year=YYYY for historical data.

Country.description: Information about countries included in the passport index

CountryRanking.description: Annual rankings and visa-free travel counts for countries
